config.question: Compared with the Plymouth Colony, the Massachusetts Bay Colony was __________.

choices.content: dedicated to complete separation from the Church of England
afflicted with corrupt and incompetent leaders
more focused on religious rather than political liberty

answer_3.response: Consider This: European diseases had destroyed many of the Indian villages near Plymouth before the Pilgrims arrived. Now the Pilgrims were able to move onto cleared land left empty by the disappearance of the Indians. In time, the Pilgrims replicated the humble little farm communities they had known in England. They formed Separatist congregations to their liking, and the population slowly increased. See L.O. 2.2 How did differences in religion affect the founding of the New England colonies?
